sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump operates between an indoor space at a temperature of 20°C and an outdoor space at a temperature of -5°C. If the heat pump consumes 2 kW of power while providing 8 kW of heating to the indoor space, what is the coefficient of performance (COP) of the heat pump?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the useful heat output (heating) to the input work (power consumed). In this case, the heat pump provides 8 kW of heating to the indoor space while consuming 2 kW of power. Therefore, the COP can be calculated as follows:

COP = (Useful heat output) / (Input work)
COP = (8 kW) / (2 kW)
COP = 4

The coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 4.
